resources.string:
The main objective of this DUT is to train specialized technicians in Web & Mobile application development, with an emphasis on: 
 
 • Programming languages (C/C++, Java, PHP) 
 • Information systems and databases 
 • Computer architecture, systems, and networks 
 • Designing, developing, and deploying Web and Mobile applications 
 
 It is also important to note that this program perfectly meets the qualification requirements. Furthermore, it is capable of effectively meeting the qualification needs of development projects installed in Nador. The aim is to train individuals with skills capable of providing scientific and fruitful support to these projects.

The DAWM training program emphasizes practical learning and prepares students to seamlessly enter the workforce. \n \n Graduates are equipped to take on diverse roles in the fields of computer science and information systems, with the option to further their education at the graduate level.

Modules Semester 1 

 M1 

Algorithmics and C Programming :
- Algorithmics
- C Programming

 M2

 Computer Architecture : 
 - Logical Circuits
 - Computer Architecture

 M3

 Mathematics: Discrete Mathematics, Linear Algebra, Probability and Statistics :
 - Analysis
 - Algebra
 - Probability and Statistics

 M4

 Language and Communication Techniques in Computer Science :
 - French
 - Communication Techniques
 - English

Modules Semester 2 

 M5 

 Data Structures in C++ :
 - Introduction to C++ language and OOP
 - Data structures.

 M6

 Linux Operating System : 
 - Internal functioning of a Linux operating system
 - User aspect.

 M7

 Information Systems and Databases :
 - Analysis and design of information systems
 - Databases

 M8

 Computer Networks and Security:
 - Computer Networks 
 - Computer Security

Modules Semester 3 

 M9 

 Software Engineering and .NET:
 - Software Engineering
 - .Net 

 M10

 Java and J2EE Programming : 
 - Java
 - J2EE.

 M11

 Mathematics: Mathematical Modeling and Operations Research :
 - Mathematical Modeling
 - Operations Research

 M12

 Advanced Databases:
 - Oracle SQL*Plus 
 - Databases using Oracle

Modules Semester 4 

 M13 

 Business Management and Entrepreneurship Workshops (project management and product development):
 - Entrepreneurship
 - Project Management and Product Development 

 M14

 Web and Mobile Development : 
 - Web Development
 - Mobile Development.

 M15

 Final Year Project :
 - FYP

 M16

 Technical Internship
 - End of Study Internship

The curriculum focuses on accounting, finance, taxation, and management information systems. The future graduate is expected to have acquired the following skills:


•Ability to master commercial and corporate law regulations.
 •Proficiency in key management tools (such as management control, budgetary control, etc.).
 •Mastery of accounting and financial techniques.
 •Acquiring language skills that enable access to the job market, particularly in English.

-Accounting Office Manager
 -Management Sector Chief
 -Assistant to the Credit Manager in a Bank
 -Customer Relationship Manager in a Bank
 -Auditor in Accounting Firms
 -Payroll Service Manager
